<h3>SciPy</h3>
SciPy (Scientific Python) is a mathematical library written in Python + C + Fortran code, well-known for Python language programmers, based on NumPy and done by about the same programmers.

<h4>Available subpackages</h4>

<ul>
<li> <b><i> constants</b></i> Physical constants and conversion factors
<li> <b><i> cluster</b></i> Vector Quantization / Kmeans
<li> <b><i> fftpack</b></i> Discrete Fourier Transform algorithms
<li> <b><i> integrate</b></i> Integration routines
<li> <b><i> interpolate</b></i> Interpolation Tools
<li> <b><i> io</b></i> Data input and output
<li> <b><i> lib</b></i> Python wrappers to external libraries
<li> <b><i> linalg</b></i> Linear algebra routines
<li> <b><i> misc</b></i> Miscellaneous utilities
<li> <b><i> optimize</b></i> Optimization Tools
<li> <b><i> sandbox</b></i> Experimental code
<li> <b><i> signal</b></i> Signal Processing Tools
<li> <b><i> sparse</b></i> Sparse Matrix Support
<li> <b><i> special</b></i> Special Functions
<li> <b><i> stats</b></i> Statistical Functions
<li> <b><i> weave</b></i> Allows the inclusion of C/C++ within Python code
</ul>
